title: 107_hr1897
content: The "Nurse of Tomorrow Act of 2001" is cited as the short title. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act include the addition of a new section on Nurse Recruitment and Retention Grants. The Secretary may award grants to healthcare facilities experiencing nursing shortages for skills training, career development, tuition reimbursement, externships, and internships for nurses and healthcare workers pursuing nursing degrees. The Secretary may award grants for nurse training and retention strategies, with a preference for financially needy applicants. Authorization of appropriations is set at $100,000,000 for fiscal year 2002, with additional funding for subsequent years. In 2006, Part D of title VIII of the Public Health Service Act was amended to strengthen capacity for basic nurse education and practice. SEC. 832. BASIC NURSE EDUCATION EXPANSION GRANTS. The Secretary may award grants to schools of nursing to expand basic nurse education, with preference given to applicants who demonstrate diversity recruitment, provide remedial education, and have plans for recruiting healthcare workers. The Secretary may award grants to schools of nursing to expand basic nurse education, with preference for diversity recruitment, remedial education, and plans to recruit healthcare workers. Schools must provide a plan for modern classrooms, labs for latest technologies, including medical error reduction, and a detailed plan to increase student enrollment over four years. "SEC. 833. Nurse education encouragement grants." The Secretary may award grants to various entities to develop programs encouraging secondary school students to choose nursing as a profession. Authorization of appropriations under the Public Health Service Act is also amended. The Public Health Service Act is amended to authorize appropriations for certain programs under Part D and the Loan Repayment Program for fiscal years 2002 through 2006. SEC. 3. AMENDMENT TO INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986. Refundable Credit for Certain Nurses. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a refundable credit for certain nurses. A tax credit of $2,000 is allowed for eligible nurses during the taxable year. The credit amount is prorated for partial years based on the number of days worked as a nurse. An eligible nurse is defined as an individual employed as a nurse at a hospital or skilled nursing facility. The text chunk describes various healthcare facilities eligible for a tax credit, including hospitals, skilled nursing facilities, nursing facilities, home health agencies, and hospice programs. Additionally, there are conforming amendments made to the United States Code related to these facilities. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code related to nurse loan repayment programs and the exclusion of certain nurse loan payments from gross income. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001.
